commands.csv: Save history as a CSV file.
commands.add_user: Add users to the expense tracker.
commands.delete_user: Delete a user from the registered users.
commands.add:
This option is for adding your expenses. 
 1. It will give you the list of categories to choose from. 
 2. You will be prompted to enter the amount corresponding to your spending. 
 3. A message will be prompted to notify the addition of your expense with the amount, date, time, and category.
commands.add_category:
This option is for adding a new category. 
 1. You will be prompted to enter a new category. 
 2. A message will be prompted to notify the addition of your category.
commands.display:
This option gives the user a graphical representation (bar graph) of their expenditures. 
 You will get an option to choose from day or month for better analysis of the expenses.
commands.estimate: This option gives you the estimate of expenditure for the next day/month. It calculates based on your recorded spendings.
commands.history: This option is to give you the detailed summary of your expenditure with Date, time, category, and amount. A quick lookup into your spendings.
commands.delete: This option is to clear/erase all your records.
commands.delete_expense: This option is to clear/erase an individual record from the expense history records.
commands.send_mail: This option is to send an email of calculated owings.
commands.edit:
This option helps you to go back and correct/update the missing details. 
 1. It will give you the list of your expenses you wish to edit. 
 2. It will let you change the specific field based on your requirements like amount/date/category.
commands.budget:
This option is to set/update/delete the budget. 
 1. The Add/update category is to set the new budget or update the existing budget. 
 2. The view category gives details if the budget is exceeding or in limit with the difference amount. 
 3. The delete category allows deleting the budget and starting afresh!
